subject: Re: Hidden Products
preview: Hi Brooke,  Thanks so much for your message.  At this stage, the site doesn’t have a bulk feature, so it looks like the SKUs will need to be made available one by one.

full_threads.body:
Hi Brooke,

Thanks so much for your message.

At this stage, the site doesn’t have a bulk feature, so it looks like the SKUs will need to be made available one by one.

Of course! That makes perfect sense. We put all of the new stock in repair status until we were ready to launch it. I will make the SKU's available now and that should solve it.

Out of interest, is there a bulk way to make all SKU's attached to the supplier Sunwings 2025 available?

Kind Regards,

BROOKE WILKINSON BUYER | BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT MANAGER
 02 8310 2285 BROOKE@HUNTLEYANDCO.COM.AU HUNTLEYANDCO.COM.AU

Hi Brooke,

We are looking into this.

Upon checking there no available SKU for "Pascal Outdoor Armchair".

Can you please confirm?

Hi Joel,

I am trying to assign 2x Pascal Outdoor Armchairs to HC120-01546. And they are not visible as an option. Even though the back end says they are NOT hidden from trade.

It appears things are still not working????

This job is being delivered tomorrow so it is rather urgent. Please help.

Thank you.

Kind Regards,

BROOKE WILKINSON BUYER | BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT MANAGER
 02 8310 2285 BROOKE@HUNTLEYANDCO.COM.AU HUNTLEYANDCO.COM.AU
(Time: 30mins)

Hi Brooke,

Confirming the products has been updated.

Here is link of the list: List of Hidden Trade Products

Hi Brooke,

Thanks so much for updating the google sheet.

We will update the products and will update you shortly :)

Hi Joel,

I think that works!

Yes please, I would very much like your assistance with this.

I have gone ahead an updated the export list Hidden Retail/Trade with exactly what products should be hidden from retail and from trade. I have also attached if need be. Can you please make this update in the system and I think we should be good to go!

Moving forward we will stick to your logic proposed below and all should work smoothly again.

Thank you for your patience with this as we get it right.

Please confirm once the system has been updated so I may begin assigning products to orders in selection.

Thank you.

Kind Regards,

BROOKE WILKINSON BUYER | BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT MANAGER
 02 8310 2285 BROOKE@HUNTLEYANDCO.COM.AU HUNTLEYANDCO.COM.AU
(Time: 30mins)

Hi Brooke,

I hope you are doing well.

We’ve updated the logic for managing hidden Retail and Trade products to make things a bit clearer:
  • If “Hide Product RFP / Retail (Subscriber)” is set to YES, the product will be hidden in Retail.
  • If “Hide Product Trades (Customer)” is set to YES, the product will be hidden in Trade.

So, if you notice products appearing in Trade that shouldn’t be visible, you can simply set “Hide Product Trades (Customer)” to YES, and they’ll be hidden from Trade.

For bulk updates, I’ve exported all products currently hidden in Retail. We’ll work with you to update the corresponding Trade products so they’re hidden as well: Hidden Retail/Trade

Please let me know if you’d like me to walk you through any of this — happy to help.

Hi Joel,

We need an urgent fix on this.

I have generated SKU codes for a heap of new products and can't see any of them in selection phase across multiple jobs. I really need to assign product and scan stock out to these to these outgoing orders quite urgently.

Is there any way to undo everything you have done around this. We should have perhaps testing this out on the staging site first.

Kind Regards,

BROOKE WILKINSON BUYER | BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT MANAGER
02 8310 2285 BROOKE@HUNTLEYANDCO.COM.AU HUNTLEYANDCO.COM.AU

Hi Joel,

Can you please tell me why I can't see a product for example the Suki Bedside Table Oak when I am logged in as trade. Even though the back end has hidden for retail and hidden for trade?

No products should ever be hidden from trade only. We don't need this functionality.

We need to be able to:



  • Hide from retail and trade (because we have discontinued an item from our range but don't want to delete it and lose all the data attached to it)


  • Hide from retail (because we don't want retail customers to have access to the newer stock)



There would be no occasion where we would want to hide from just trade.

Kind Regards,

BROOKE WILKINSON BUYER | BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT MANAGER
 02 8310 2285 BROOKE@HUNTLEYANDCO.COM.AU HUNTLEYANDCO.COM.AU

Hi Brooke,

Thanks so much for the additional details.

We’ve now set up two columns: Hide Product (Retail) and Hide Product (Trade). These will form the basis for which products are hidden in each channel.

At present, the Hide Product (Retail) column is still being used to hide products from both Retail and Trade. I’ve kept this functionality in place temporarily until we’ve correctly identified which products should be hidden in Trade only.

To update this:
  1. Go to Backend Products.
  2. In the top right, open Screen Options and set Number of items per page to 500.
  3. Set Hidden Retail Products to Yes and press Filter (this will display all hidden Retail products).
  4. From here, you can select the products that should also be hidden in Trade and update them accordingly.

Once the Trade product settings are finalized, I’ll adjust the code so that only the correct products are hidden in the Trade view.

Let me know if this works for you — happy to help if you need a hand :)

Hi Joel,

Where are we at with this?

I can no longer see the product we retired from the range when logged in to trade site - which is great. But now I can't see any of the new stock in our range that we have hidden from retail but want our trade clients to see.

Kind Regards,

BROOKE WILKINSON BUYER | BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT MANAGER
02 8310 2285 BROOKE@HUNTLEYANDCO.COM.AU HUNTLEYANDCO.COM.AU

Hi Joel,

Is it worth us jumping on a call about this? It is still not working. I am currently logged in as a trade customer and I can see a heap of sofa's in 3 seat sofa's that used to be hidden (because we discontinued them from our range) but are now visible. This is hugely problematic for us. These need to stay hidden as we no longer carry them. Along with hundreds of other items that can now be seen across all categories.

Ie:

Ada 3 Seat Sofa Charcoal
Allegra 3 Seat Sofa
London 3 Seat Sofa
Remy 3 Seat Sofa
Soho 3 Seat Sofa

Is there a way to undo everything that has been actioned around this request until we can come up with how best to roll this our properly?

Kind Regards,

BROOKE WILKINSON BUYER | BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT MANAGER
 02 8310 2285 BROOKE@HUNTLEYANDCO.COM.AU HUNTLEYANDCO.COM.AU
(Time: 15mins)

Hi Brooke,

I hope you are doing well.

Here is the updated logic setup to the site.
  • We've created column "Hide Product (Retail)" "Hide Product (Trade)"
  • For Trades
    • If "Hide Product (Trade)" is equal to yes, this will be hidden
    • Before: it was being hidden if "Hide Product (Retail)" is equal to yes (We have now removed this)

We can confirm that its working now. You also filter the "Hidden Retail Products" and "Hidden Trade Products"

https://huntleyandco.com.au/dashboard/catalogues/?cat=31

https://huntleyandco.com.au/dashboard/#/catalogues/?s=oslo

Hi Joel,

I still can't see products such as the Oslo Occasional Chair or Bianca Armchair when I am logged in as trade (via the product menu). Back end they are hidden from retail but not from trade.

Also, if something is set to hidden from trade. We want it hidden from their product gallery view but we still need to be able to see it in catalogue view (something they do not have access to). I generated hundreds of SKU's for our new Pascal range last week. Which we have hidden from retail and trade until we wait for the photos to come back (it is all new stock that has just been photographed. We generated codes so our warehouse team can code and put furniture away up on to the racking). We need to be able to see absolutely everything in catalogue view. Nothing is coming up when I search Pascal in product view. But in back end, there are 115 SKU's. I have put them into repair for now so that clients can't select them. But I should still be able to see this info in front end in the catalogue view.



Kind Regards

BROOKE WILKINSON BUYER | BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT MANAGER
 02 8310 2285 BROOKE@HUNTLEYANDCO.COM.AU HUNTLEYANDCO.COM.AU
(Time: 15mins)

Hi Brooke,

Thanks so much for your patience and for flagging this — really appreciate you keeping such a close eye on things. We’ve gone ahead and updated the site to correct the issue.

Here’s a quick overview of how it now works:

For RFP/Retail (Subscriber):
  • When “Hide Product RFP / Retail (Subscriber)” is set to Yes, the product will now redirect to /hire/ .
  • Example: Oslo Occasional Chair

For Trades (Customer):
  • Products hidden from Retail will continue to be hidden, and now we’ve also added a new field: Hide Product Trades (Customer).
  • When this is set to Yes, the product will be hidden from Trade view as well.
  • You can check the Trade view here: Catalogue Link

Search Filter:
  • We’ve also added a Search Filter update, so hidden products will no longer appear in the search results for either Retail or Trade when marked as hidden.

If you’d like to hide a product from both Trade and Retail:
  • Simply set both fields to Hidden.

This should stop the unintended visibility you mentioned, while still giving you flexibility over how products display across customer types.
Please let me know if you’d like me to walk you through an example or test a few more products together.

Hi Joel,

Something has gone wrong here.....

Please use Oslo Occasional Chair as example. Back end has this product hidden from Retail/Subscriber only. I can now see it when logged in as a Trade/Customer which is great. And while I can't see it on the retail site, I can search for it via the search bar and can find it that way. Ideally, we don't want people being able to do this.

But here is where things have gone more wrong. When I am logged in as Trade/Customer, I can now see all of the hundreds of products we have hidden over the years (which were discontinued from our range). For example the Allegra 3 Seat Sofa. If I search by product name on the retail site via the search bar, I can also be taken to it. Which you should not be able to do.

Please help us correct this.

Thank you.

Brooke
(Time: 45mins)

Hi Brooke,

Happy Monday! I hope you had a really lovely weekend. Thanks so much for checking this again — I truly appreciate your patience with me while I got a little muddled earlier.

When logged in with an RFP/Retail account (Subscriber role):
  • https://huntleyandco.com.au/catalogue/oslo-occasional-chair-oatmeal/

Thanks again, Brooke. I really appreciate your help testing this. Please let me know if everything looks good on your end.

Hi Joel,

Could you please investigate further.

Thank you.

Kind Regards,

BROOKE WILKINSON BUYER | BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT MANAGER
